page.title: 06LEITH'S PROBLEMS
page.content: Slowly but surely the face of Leith is changing. {Industrial decline and {urban decay,}clearance of the old housing stock and population dispersal, economic stagnation - all characteristics once familiar in the inner city areas throughout Scotland - have given way to{new hope and {regeneration. Problems such as misery and depriv- :ation: physical illness, marital breakdown, violence and crime, mental stress, exacerbation of pressures on the social services have been tackled. New enterprises have been born, ugly gap-sites have been developed or land- :scaped and transformed into small parks. Old buildings have been given a new lease of life and the quality of the housing is improving and expanding. { }
